name: UGameUserSettings
doc: Stores user settings for a game (for example graphics and sound settings), with the ability to save and load to and from a file.

methods.name: ApplyHardwareBenchmarkResults
methods.doc: Applies the settings stored in ScalabilityQuality and saves settings

methods.name: ApplySettings
methods.doc: Applies all current user settings to the game and saves to permanent storage (e.g. file), optionally checking for command line overrides.

methods.name: ConfirmVideoMode
methods.doc: Mark current video mode settings (fullscreenmode/resolution) as being confirmed by the user

methods.name: EnableHDRDisplayOutput
methods.doc: Enables or disables HDR display output. Can be called again to change the desired nit level

methods.name: GetAntiAliasingQuality
methods.doc: Returns the anti-aliasing quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetAudioQualityLevel
methods.doc: Returns the user's audio quality level setting

methods.name: GetCurrentHDRDisplayNits
methods.doc: Returns 0 if HDR isn't supported or is turned off

methods.name: GetDefaultResolutionScale
methods.doc: Gets the desired resolution quality based on DesiredScreenWidth/Height and the current screen resolution

methods.name: GetDesktopResolution
methods.doc: Returns user's desktop resolution, in pixels.

methods.name: GetFoliageQuality
methods.doc: Returns the foliage quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetFrameRateLimit
methods.doc: Gets the user's frame rate limit (0 indiciates the frame rate limit is disabled)

methods.name: GetFullscreenMode
methods.doc: Returns the user setting for game window fullscreen mode.

methods.name: GetGlobalIlluminationQuality
methods.doc: Returns the global illumination quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetLastConfirmedFullscreenMode
methods.doc: Returns the last confirmed user setting for game window fullscreen mode.

methods.name: GetLastConfirmedScreenResolution
methods.doc: Returns the last confirmed user setting for game screen resolution, in pixels.

methods.name: GetOverallScalabilityLevel
methods.doc: Returns the overall scalability level (can return -1 if the settings are custom)

methods.name: GetPostProcessingQuality
methods.doc: Returns the post-processing quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetPreferredFullscreenMode
methods.doc: Returns the user setting for game window fullscreen mode.

methods.name: GetRecommendedResolutionScale
methods.doc: Gets the recommended resolution quality based on LastRecommendedScreenWidth/Height and the current screen resolution

methods.name: GetReflectionQuality
methods.doc: Returns the reflection quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetResolutionScaleInformationEx
methods.doc: Returns the current resolution scale and the range

methods.name: GetResolutionScaleNormalized
methods.doc: Gets the current resolution scale as a normalized 0..1 value between MinScaleValue and MaxScaleValue

methods.name: GetScreenResolution
methods.doc: Returns the user setting for game screen resolution, in pixels.

methods.name: GetShadingQuality
methods.doc: Returns the shading quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetShadowQuality
methods.doc: Returns the shadow quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetTextureQuality
methods.doc: Returns the texture quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetViewDistanceQuality
methods.doc: Returns the view distance quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: GetVisualEffectQuality
methods.doc: Returns the visual effects quality (0..4, higher is better)

methods.name: IsDirty
methods.doc: Checks if any user settings is different from current

methods.name: IsDynamicResolutionDirty
methods.doc: Checks if the dynamic resolution user setting is different from current system setting

methods.name: IsDynamicResolutionEnabled
methods.doc: Returns the user setting for dynamic resolution.

methods.name: IsFullscreenModeDirty
methods.doc: Checks if the FullscreenMode user setting is different from current

methods.name: IsScreenResolutionDirty
methods.doc: Checks if the Screen Resolution user setting is different from current

methods.name: IsVSyncDirty
methods.doc: Checks if the vsync user setting is different from current system setting

methods.name: IsVSyncEnabled
methods.doc: Returns the user setting for vsync.

methods.name: LoadSettings
methods.doc: Loads the user settings from persistent storage

methods.name: ResetToCurrentSettings
methods.doc: This function resets all settings to the current system settings

methods.name: RevertVideoMode
methods.doc: Revert video mode (fullscreenmode/resolution) back to the last user confirmed values

methods.name: RunHardwareBenchmark
methods.doc: Runs the hardware benchmark and populates ScalabilityQuality as well as the last benchmark results config members, but does not apply the settings it determines. Designed to be called in conjunction with ApplyHardwareBenchmarkResults

methods.name: SaveSettings
methods.doc: Save the user settings to persistent storage (automatically happens as part of ApplySettings)

methods.name: SetAntiAliasingQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the anti-aliasing quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetAudioQualityLevel
methods.doc: Sets the user's audio quality level setting

methods.name: SetBenchmarkFallbackValues
methods.doc: Set scalability settings to sensible fallback values, for use when the benchmark fails or potentially causes a crash

methods.name: SetDynamicResolutionEnabled
methods.doc: Sets the user setting for dynamic resolution. See UGameUserSettings::bUseDynamicResolution.

methods.name: SetFoliageQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the foliage quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetFrameRateLimit
methods.doc: Sets the user's frame rate limit (0 will disable frame rate limiting)

methods.name: SetFullscreenMode
methods.doc: Sets the user setting for the game window fullscreen mode. See UGameUserSettings::FullscreenMode.

methods.name: SetGlobalIlluminationQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the global illumination quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetOverallScalabilityLevel
methods.doc:
Changes all scalability settings at once based on a single overall quality level
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic

methods.name: SetPostProcessingQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the post-processing quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetReflectionQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the reflection quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetResolutionScaleNormalized
methods.doc: Sets the current resolution scale as a normalized 0..1 value between MinScaleValue and MaxScaleValue

methods.name: SetResolutionScaleValueEx
methods.doc: Sets the current resolution scale

methods.name: SetScreenResolution
methods.doc: Sets the user setting for game screen resolution, in pixels.

methods.name: SetShadingQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the shading quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetShadowQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the shadow quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetTextureQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the texture quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic  (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetViewDistanceQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the view distance quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetVisualEffectQuality
methods.doc:
Sets the visual effects quality (0..4, higher is better)
@param Value 0:low, 1:medium, 2:high, 3:epic, 4:cinematic (gets clamped if needed)

methods.name: SetVSyncEnabled
methods.doc: Sets the user setting for vsync. See UGameUserSettings::bUseVSync.

methods.name: SupportsHDRDisplayOutput
methods.doc: Whether the curently running system supports HDR display output

methods.name: ValidateSettings
methods.doc: Validates and resets bad user settings to default. Deletes stale user settings file if necessary.
